TWE 2.0 Design Onboarding Checklist
1. Design roadmap
- [ ] Review UX pain points of TWE 1.0 and provide context on current state
- [ ] Review design roadmap for TWE 2.0, design constraints for first release, and planned improvements for future releases
- [ ] Walkthrough current state in Figma and local
- [ ] Provide context on OB3 changes and how they impact our designs.

2. Ways of working
- [ ] Review TWE design and content principles ([Figma](https://figma-gov.com/board/ey324NtRtJ6KwvqqaKSzn0/TWE-Design-Team-Sandbox?node-id=1595-4381&t=bLCZcgJrqzrjHUHu-1))
- [ ] Expectation for designers to understand complex tax logic + examples
- [ ] Content review process
- [ ] Review design-to-eng handoff
- [ ] Design and accessibility [review process](https://github.com/IRSDigitalService/trust/blob/main/docs/design/design-review-process.md)

3. Design Tooling
- [ ] Intro to design system
- [ ] Design's use of github
- [ ] Overview of relevant TWE Figma and Figjam boards
- [ ] Direct File [all screens](https://github.com/IRSDigitalService/trust/blob/main/docs/design/all%20screens%20-%20without%20alerts.pdf) as a template for TWE and other projects

4. Research
- [ ] Share insights from user research, analytics, design crits, secondary research, etc. that have shaped requirements
- [ ] Overview of TWE research [Figma board](https://figma-gov.com/board/PcyU8D7RDfDHszweWduMGh/TWE-User-Research?node-id=1-104&t=pmFRasTUhO0dm7jd-1)
- [ ] Walkthrough research process

5. Design starter tasks
- [ ] Use TWE 1.0
- [ ] Observe or notetake a research session
- [ ] Pair with a designer (and eng) on a simple piece of tax logic
- [ ] Share work in progress with design CoP and Slack to get into habit of asking for and receiving feedback
